metadata.title: CVE-2022-3424 on Ubuntu 22.04 LTS (jammy) - medium
metadata.description:
A use-after-free flaw was found in the Linux kernelâ€™s SGI GRU driver in theway the first gru_file_unlocked_ioctl function is called by the user, wherea fail pass occurs in the gru_check_chiplet_assignment function. This flawallows a local user to crash or potentially escalate their privileges onthe system.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-3424` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-5.15.0-69-generic - 5.15.0-69.76
linux-image-5.15.0-69-generic-lpae - 5.15.0-69.76
linux-image-unsigned-5.15.0-69-generic - 5.15.0-69.76
linux-image-unsigned-5.15.0-69-generic-64k - 5.15.0-69.76
No subscription required

No subscription required

criterions.comment: linux package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.15.0-69.76').
linux-kvm package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.15.0-1030.35').
linux-aws package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.15.0-1033.37').
linux-azure package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.15.0-1035.42').
linux-azure-fde package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.15.0-1035.42').
linux-gcp package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.15.0-1031.38').
linux-gke package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.15.0-1030.35').
linux-gkeop package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.15.0-1017.22').
linux-ibm package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.15.0-1027.30').
linux-intel-iotg package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.15.0-1027.32').
linux-lowlatency package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.15.0-69.76').
linux-oracle package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.15.0-1032.38').
linux-oem-5.17: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'superseded by linux-oem-6.1, was needed').
linux-raspi package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.15.0-1026.28').
linux-oem-6.0: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'superseded by linux-oem-6.1, was needed').
linux-oem-6.1 package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '6.1.0-1006.6').
linux-hwe-5.19 package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.19.0-40.41~22.04.1').
linux-lowlatency-hwe-5.19 package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.19.0-1022.23~22.04.1').
linux-azure-5.19 package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.19.0-1023.24~22.04.1').
linux-nvidia package in jammy is affected. An update containing the fix has been completed and is pending publication (note: '5.15.0-1023.23').
linux-oem-6.5 package in jammy, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '6.5.0-1003.3').
